page.title: 01GENERAL OVERVIEW
page.content: This area falls into two clear parts. To the west are the villages of Kiveton Park and Wales while to the east is South Anston. The two parts are separated by a belt of land which is made up of open agricultural land to the north and a small industrial complex of quarries and a steel works to the south. The contrast between the two parts is marked. South Anston is basically an ancient village but many new houses have been built in recent years. It is now largely a dormitory village for Sheffield, Rotherham and Worksop. Kiveton Park, which includes the village of Wales, also has ancient origins but is now basically a mining village with much local authority and NCB housing. Most people are employed locally, either in the pit or steel works.
